intro: Anigozanthos bicolor, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a species of flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the plant family Haemodoraceae, which includes several species of ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red and yellow flowers, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners in arid regions. Its unique appearance and seasonal blooming make it a notable feature in native Australian landscapes.
